title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 111.5 - Requirements for admission
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 111.5 - Requirements for admission

State Regulations

Applicants shall possess unique and distinctive skills, qualifications and talents in the art form of the school to which application
is made. (a) Application shall be made
on forms designated by the commissioner. (b) Students shall be selected on the basis
of an open competitive screening procedure through audition, portfolio review
or film/media demonstration as appropriate to the art form of the school to
which application is made. (c) Applicants shall demonstrate artistic maturity, skill development and knowledge
consistent with the preprofessional nature of the program and the particular
art form of each school. (d) After
completion of the open competitive screening procedure, a list of qualified
students shall be established for each school. The maximum number of students
to be accepted to each school shall be determined by the executive director
based upon financial resources available to the school. If sufficient numbers
of qualified students are not available, the school shall operate at a lower
number of students. If more qualified students than the maximum are identified, an alternate list shall be formed. Students shall be selected from the
alternate list on the basis of rank based on the screening procedure. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
111.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
